t: To the choirmaster: with stringed instruments. A Psalm of David.
Answer*pn me when I call, O God of my righteousness! You*ld have given me relief when I was in distress. Be*ld gracious to me and hear my prayer!
O*pn men, how long shall my honor be turned into shame? How*ld long will you love vain words and seek after lies? Selah*ig
But*ln know that the Lord*s has set apart the godly for himself; the*ld Lord*s hears when I call to him.
Be*pn angry, and do not sin; ponder*ld in your own hearts on your beds, and be silent. Selah*ig
Offer*ln right sacrifices, and*ld put your trust in the Lord.*s
There*pn are many who say, “Who will show us some good? Lift*ld up the light of your face upon us, O Lord!”*s
You*ln have put more joy in my heart than*ld they have when their grain and wine abound.
In*pn peace I will both lie down and sleep; for*ld you alone, O Lord,*s make me dwell in safety.
